comments.content: IMO first service has to detect cars i.e. objects, therefore object detection would be required
I agreed it's text extraction, question is stating to retrieve "registration numbers", it's identifying textual information within videos
The cars are already detected from the CCTV footage, you are asked here what service to use to extract license plate information, which is text extraction using OCR.

discussion.content:
I think the answer is text extraction

Since the goal is to extract the vehicle registration numbers from the CCTV footage, text extraction using OCR algorithms would be the most appropriate choice. OCR algorithms can recognize and extract text information from images, making it possible to retrieve the registration numbers from the captured video frames. This enables automated monitoring and analysis of the traffic data by extracting the relevant textual information.
Correct answer is text extraction , the only way to collect registration number is OCR which is text extraction, object detection is useful to find a car

It should be Object Detection.

https://www.c-sharpcorner.com/article/number-plate-recognition-with-azure-custom-vision-and-azure-computer-vision/

comments.content: This links clearly mentioned text extraction/OCR to get the plate number not object detection.

discussion.content: A traffic monitoring system that collects vehicle registration numbers from CCTV footage is an example of "text extraction" in the Computer Vision service. Text extraction, specifically optical character recognition (OCR), is the process of recognizing and extracting alphanumeric characters from images or video frames. In the context of a traffic monitoring system, OCR algorithms can be applied to extract the registration numbers from the license plates captured in the CCTV footage. This enables automated data collection and analysis of vehicle registration information for traffic monitoring and related purposes.
It it first Object dectection, text extraction after that. Or can text extraction direct extract from video

A traffic monitoring system that collects vehicle registration numbers from CCTV footage is an example of text extraction in the Computer Vision service. Text extraction is the process of identifying and extracting text from images, which includes tasks like recognizing license plate numbers in the context of vehicle registration numbers. Image classification, object detection, and spatial analysis are different types of computer vision tasks that focus on categorizing or locating objects in images but not necessarily extracting textual information.

The answer should be text extraction.

OCR or Optical Character Recognition is also referred to as text recognition or text extraction.

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/computer-vision/overview-ocr

I would choose text extraction as it falls under Computer Vision - Image Analysis service - see example here: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/computer-vision/concept-ocr#text-extraction-example

Which Azure Cognitive Services service should you use?

discussion.content:
Face: While Face can detect faces, it wouldn't be suitable for tagging general objects or scenes in social media images that might not contain people.
Therefore, D - Computer Vision

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

You have an app that identifies birds in images. The app performs the following tasks:

• Identifies the location of the birds in the image
• Identifies the species of the birds in the image

Which type of computer vision does each task use? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

discussion.content: correct only
Think the answers are correct, but using a Custom Vision Image Classification Model, you would be able to use Obejct Detection as well (assuming it is trained on the species of bird)
speech recognition would be required only if we were dealing with audio input.

comments.content: the term here is "manuscript" (handwritten / text input) in different languages - so it should be translation + key phrase extraction

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
the term here is "manuscript" (handwritten / text input) in different languages - so it should be translation + key phrase extraction

Selected Answer: C
Here is the answer quoted from MS Copilot:
"The solution you described involves reading manuscripts in different languages and categorizing them based on topic. This would primarily involve:
1. Translation: To convert the content of the manuscripts from various languages to a language the model can understand.
2. Key Phrase Extraction: To identify and extract the main topics or themes from the manuscript content.
So, the correct answer is C. translation and key phrase extraction. Please note that depending on the specific requirements of the solution, other NLP tasks could also be relevant. For example, entity recognition could be used to identify specific entities within the text, and sentiment analysis could be used to understand the tone or sentiment of the manuscript. However, based on the information provided, translation and key phrase extraction are the most directly relevant tasks."
B. Speech Recognition and language service.
Answer is correct

questions.question_text:

Which types of natural language processing (NLP) workloads does the solution use?
